intro: Humboltia miqueliana, commonly known as the Mexican sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Humboltia miqueliana is often found in coastal and desert regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
